text: <@UJE5LQ2JC> as my manager is Head of Global Communications (our structure is a bit funky), I technically cannot be a “Head” while still reporting to her. But I agree with you this would make the most sense.

elements.text: as my manager is Head of Global Communications (our structure is a bit funky), I technically cannot be a “Head” while still reporting to her. But I agree with you this would make the most sense.

text:
Hi Folks,

I would love your advice and expert knowledge.

I am pivoting careers coming from non profit management - I mainly manage a program from it's onset and ensure that it will scale and can be sustained.

So I guess I would be in the 0-2 year range for a marketing role.

I am interested in content writing, content  marketing, and/or client service/account manager roles. I am also open to social media management.

I've done a few content writer role interviews and the tricky  bit is experience, that's the feedback I get from hiring managers.

I'm curious and interested in marketing. I tool an 8 month accelerator course in digital marketing and it grew in me that curiosity.

I was thinking of applying for roles with marketing companies that I love and grow into my ideal role.

What would be your thoughts?

What other titles would you suggest I explore in B2B, B2C?

Thank you!

elements.text:

I am pivoting careers coming from non profit management - I mainly manage a program from it's onset and ensure that it will scale and can be sustained.

So I guess I would be in the 0-2 year range for a marketing role.

I've done a few content writer role interviews and the tricky  bit is experience, that's the feedback I get from hiring managers.
